speaker: banquo
dialog: And now we are going to transition into Shakespeare! Everyone excited?

speaker: macbeth
dialog: Uhhhhhh we gotta google translate literally everything...

speaker: banquo
dialog: I'm gonna start. How goes the night, boy?

speaker: fleance
dialog: The moon is down; I have not heard the clock.

speaker: banquo
dialog: And she goes down at twelve.

speaker: banquo
dialog: Hold, take my sword. There's husbandry in heaven. Their candles are all out. Take thee that too. A heavy summons lies like lead upon me, And yet I would not sleep: merciful powers, Restrain in me the cursed thoughts that nature Gives way to in repose!

speaker: banquo
dialog: Give me my sword. Who's there?.

speaker: banquo
dialog: What, sir, not yet at rest? The king's a-bed: He hath been in unusual pleasure, and Sent forth great largess to your offices This diamond he greets your wife withal, By the name of most kind hostess; and shut up In measureless content.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: Being unprepared, Our will became the servant to defect; Which else should free have wrought.

speaker: banquo
dialog: All's well. I dreamt last night of the three weird sisters: To you they have show'd some truth.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: I think not of them: Yet, when we can entreat an hour to serve, We would spend it in some words upon that business, If you would grant the time.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: If you shall cleave to my consent, when 'tis, It shall make honour for you.

speaker: banquo
dialog: So I lose none In seeking to augment it, but still keep My bosom franchised and allegiance clear, I shall be counsell'd.

speaker: banquo
dialog: Thanks, sir: the like to you!
